# Expense Categories & Tax Reference

## Category Definitions

### Software & Subscriptions (100% Deductible)
SaaS tools, cloud services, productivity software used for business.

Examples:
- Supabase, Vercel, Netlify, AWS, DigitalOcean
- Claude Pro, ChatGPT Plus, GitHub Copilot
- Notion, Linear, Figma, Canva
- Adobe Creative Cloud
- Slack, Zoom, Google Workspace

### Domains & Hosting (100% Deductible)
Website infrastructure costs.

Examples:
- Domain registrations (Namecheap, Cloudflare, GoDaddy)
- Hosting fees
- SSL certificates
- CDN services

### Office & Equipment (100% Deductible)
Hardware and physical items for business use.

Examples:
- Computers, monitors, keyboards, mice
- Desk, chair, standing desk
- Webcam, microphone, lighting
- Cables, adapters, peripherals
- Printer, scanner

**Note:** Items over $2,500 may need to be depreciated rather than expensed. Consult CPA.

### Professional Services (100% Deductible)
Experts you pay for business help.

Examples:
- CPA/accountant fees
- Legal fees (business-related)
- Consulting fees
- Freelancer/contractor payments
- Bookkeeping services

**1099 Requirement:** Issue 1099-NEC to contractors paid $600+ in calendar year.

### Education & Training (100% Deductible)
Learning that maintains or improves business skills.

Examples:
- Online courses (Udemy, Coursera, etc.)
- Books and ebooks
- Conference tickets
- Workshop fees
- Certification exams

### Marketing & Advertising (100% Deductible)
Promoting the business.

Examples:
- Google Ads, Facebook Ads
- Sponsored content
- Business cards, flyers
- Promotional materials
- Social media tools (Buffer, Hootsuite)

### Travel (100% Deductible)
Business travel expenses.

Examples:
- Airfare
- Hotels
- Rental cars
- Uber/Lyft for business
- Parking and tolls
- Per diem meals (while traveling)

**Keep:** Receipts + documentation of business purpose.

### Home Office (% Deductible)
If you use part of home exclusively for business.

**Simplified method:** $5 per square foot, max 300 sq ft ($1,500 max)

**Regular method:** Calculate % of home used for business, apply to:
- Rent or mortgage interest
- Utilities
- Home insurance
- Repairs/maintenance

**Requirement:** Space must be used EXCLUSIVELY and REGULARLY for business.

### Bank & Filing Fees (100% Deductible)
Business account and government fees.

Examples:
- LLC filing fee ($125)
- Annual report fee ($138.75)
- Business bank account fees
- Payment processing fees (Stripe, PayPal)
- Business credit card annual fees

### Meals & Entertainment (50% Deductible)
Business meals with clients, partners, or for business discussion.

Examples:
- Client lunches/dinners
- Business meeting meals
- Team meals (if applicable)

**Requirements:**
- Must be business-related
- Document: date, amount, attendees, business purpose
- Only 50% deductible

**Not deductible:** Personal meals, entertainment (concerts, sports), gifts over $25/person

## Receipt Requirements

**Keep receipts for:**
- All expenses over $75
- All travel expenses regardless of amount
- All meals regardless of amount

**Receipt should show:**
- Vendor name
- Date
- Amount
- What was purchased

**Digital receipts OK:** Email confirmations, screenshots, photos of paper receipts.

## Quarterly Review Checklist

- [ ] All expenses categorized
- [ ] Receipts attached for items >$75
- [ ] Meals documented with business purpose
- [ ] Mileage logged (if applicable)
- [ ] Running totals updated
- [ ] Unusual items flagged for CPA

## Year-End Checklist

- [ ] All 12 months reconciled
- [ ] Annual totals by category
- [ ] 1099s prepared for contractors ($600+)
- [ ] Home office calculation done
- [ ] Mileage total calculated
- [ ] All receipts organized and backed up
- [ ] Documents ready for CPA

## Common Mistakes to Avoid

1. **Mixing personal/business** — Even one personal expense from business account is a problem
2. **Missing receipts** — No receipt = harder to defend in audit
3. **Wrong category** — Consistency matters
4. **Missing 1099s** — Penalty is $50-280 per form
5. **No home office documentation** — Measure the space, take photos
6. **Meals without notes** — Who, what, why for every meal
